definition: Western Jin dynasty (265-316)
west
the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish
to move forward/to promote/to advance
surname Jin/the Jin Dynasties (265-420)/Western Jin 西晉|西晋[Xi1 Jin4] (265-316), Eastern Jin 東晉|东晋[Dong1 Jin4] (317-420) and Later Jin Dynasty (936-946)/short name for Shanxi province 山西[Shan1 xi1]

sentences.english: Pan Yue was one of the most important representative writers in the Western Jin Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 潘岳是西晋文坛上具有代表性的作家。

sentences.english: Guo Xiang is an important representative of Xuanxue in the West Jin Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 郭象是西晋玄学的重要代表人物。

sentences.english: Western Jin Dynasty established in Nanjing, Qujing becomes one of the country's 19 states.
sentences.chinese: 西晋王朝设宁州，曲靖成为全国19州之一。

sentences.english: Chicken-headed teapots of the time were vastly different from those of Western Jin.
sentences.chinese: 鸡首型茶壶与西晋时期的茶壶有极大的不同。

sentences.english: However from the West Jin to the Southern and Northern dynasties, the nine grades of the families had been fixed.
sentences.chinese: 但是从西晋到南北朝，户分九品之制已经定型化。

sentences.english: Book of Sheng is an important translation works of Zhu Fahu, a translator during Western Jin Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 《生经》是西晋时期译经家竺法护的重要译作。

sentences.english: After Western Jin's south unification, some of the Kingdom Wu's system retained.
sentences.chinese: 西晋统一南方后，孙吴旧制还有所保留。

sentences.english: The Qitai Yangge is the typical representative folk drama in central Shanxi.
sentences.chinese: 祁太秧歌是民间小戏在山西晋中的典型代表。

definition: Jin Dynasty (265-420)

Later Han or Eastern Han dynasty (25-220)/Later Han of the Five Dynasties (947-950)
Western Han Dynasty (206 BC-8 AD), also called 前漢|前汉[Qian2 Han4], Former Han Dynasty
Wei of the Northern Dynasties (386-534), founded by the Tuoba 拓跋 branch of Xianbei 鮮卑|鲜卑
the Northern Zhou Dynasty (557-581)/one of the Northern Dynasties
Han dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)/refers to the Western Han and Eastern Han
Sixteen Kingdoms of Five non-Han people (ruling most of China 304-439)/also written 五胡十六國|五胡十六国
Sui dynasty (581-617)
Sixteen Kingdoms of Five non-Han people (ruling most of China 304-439)
Wei, Jin and North-South dynasties/generic term for historic period 220-589 between Han and Sui
Cheng Han of the Sixteen Kingdoms (304-347)
